text:
No worries! Congratulations! I’m glad you found a new place, fingers crossed the baby waits until after the move haha :blush: Don’t feel pressured to respond quickly, you’ve got a lot on right now, so I hope you and your partner take it easy!
Andreas Wannerstedt was one of my first inspirations for getting into 3D modelling and animation in the first place! These days I am more inspired by more stylized feature animation, focusing on conveying feeling and emotion or possibly animation for video games. Blue Zoo are currently animating a Paddington Bear series which is incredibly charming, I really enjoy that kind of highly stylized animation. The stop motion feel is very pleasant to watch. More recently I saw this piece from Passion Animation which was amazing, it’s called ‘Borrowed Time’ <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=aGiC9Mg91eQ>. ‘Best Friend’ is also another really amazing piece even though its not 3D <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=j01Hg4QJ6NE>.
I’m planning on trying all kinds of 3D animation though to see what I actually enjoy creating, really looking forward to summer to dedicate a lot of time on it. I’m currently in first year and trying everything VFX, games and 3d related so I don’t actually have enough time to animate as I would like to but I’m grateful for it as I’ve just started my first rigging project and I feel like my drawing skills are really improving! Just getting controllers and the joints in place now but I really enjoy making the naming structure, it feels really satisfying. I think paint weighting will be really fun.
I wasn’t aware of how divided jobs are in the industry so thank you for clarifying that! Are most people only extremely well versed in 1/2 areas or is it more common to have 3/4 really well developed skills?
